summary:
Pepsi is a popular cola-flavored soda, second only to Coca-Cola in global brand value. Created in 1893 by Caleb Bradham, it was originally called "Brad's Drink." The name was changed to Pepsi-Cola in 1898 and later shortened to Pepsi.

After financial struggles, Pepsi was revived and gained popularity during the Great Depression. It targeted African Americans in its marketing, boosting its success. Pepsi's rivalry with Coca-Cola, known as the "cola wars," has shaped the soft drink industry. Pepsi continues to innovate, expanding globally and introducing new products and marketing ideas.
title: Pepsi
